revised_title: Experimental Researches in Electro-Magnetism: Challenges and Discoveries
tldr: Dr. Ritchie's paper investigates the inaccuracies of the common deflecting galvanometer and the laws governing the conducting power of a wire for electricity. He also examines the lifting power of electro-magnets and their relation to length, energy, and the quality of materials used. Additionally, he describes a method for obtaining a continuous current of electricity through the induction of common magnets and discusses the limitations of electro-magnetic power in chemical decomposition.
